name: Cauliflower "Mac and Cheese" Bake
description: Replace macaroni with cauliflower in our twist on a classic Mac and Cheese. Our imposter pasta is sure to become a new family favourite.
recipeIngredient: 1 ½ cups CRACKER BARREL Shredded Double Cheddar Cheese, divided
⅓ cup KRAFT 100% Parmesan Aged Grated Cheese, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Cook cauliflower in boiling water in large saucepan 4 minutes; drain well.

Melt 2 Tbsp. margarine in large saucepan on medium heat. Add onions; cook and stir 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Stir in flour and mustard; cook and stir 1 minute. Whisk in milk; cook 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Add 1-1/4 cups Cheddar and 3 Tbsp. Parmesan; stir until Cheddar is melted. Add cauliflower; stir to evenly coat. Spoon into 2.5-L casserole dish sprayed with cooking spray.
Microwave remaining margarine in medium microwaveable bowl on HIGH 30 sec. or until melted. Stir in bread crumbs and remaining Parmesan; sprinkle over cauliflower mixture.
Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until heated through, topping with remaining Cheddar for the last 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made this exactly as written. Turns out 6 cups of small florets is two heads of cauliflower.

Needs salt. I made this as written but reduced the milk to 2 cups and reduced the flour to 1/4 cup. The flour to fat ratio is way off compared to any recipe or dish I've ever made.. But decided to roll with it with the minor adjustments. The end result was creamy and I was pleased with the consistency. This dish could really benefit with the addition of salt possibly herbs some hot sauce or jalepenos and garlic. I will definitely make a variation of this again trying a different cheese.. Maybe the tex mex blend. Also will try roasting the cauliflower instead of boiling to add more flavor and keep more of the nutrition.

I loved it! I ll definitely make this again when I m craving some Mac n cheese (healthy version). I used coconut flour instead of white flour for a little extra keto-friendliness. You can t taste the difference between the two flours. And I also cut some kielbasa sausage for that extra saltiness people have been commenting on. Yum:)
I took the advice of another reviewer and added salt and fresh ground pepper. Cut back on the milk and flour. Very good. Will make this again.
Excellent. Easy to make and tasty and a bit healthier for you.

would have given this 5 stars had the sauce been a little "tighter". i found it somewhat soupy which is not a bad thing but i like mine a little tighter. when i make this again i will use perhaps 1 cup less milk. i used the Cracker Barrel Shreds Double Cheddar 35% less fat variety. i like to cut the fat where i can. this cheese is very cheesy. if i didn't know it was the less fat type i would have never been able to tell. oh i did place it under the broiler for just a bit to get it nice and golden brown on top. My son who does not like cauliflower took what was left over home!:)

We really liked this my son asked for the leftovers for his lunch! I read online that 6 cups of cauliflower is a 4 lb head of cauliflower I had a 2 lb head so I halved the recipe. I microwaved the cauliflower instead of boiling as I don't like boiled vegetables. Baked in my convection oven at 350 degrees for 25 minutes it was browned nicely on top and bubbly. Will definitely make again. #Ad #AllrecipesAllstarsCA #EndWithAmazing

We enjoyed this as a side dish for Easter dinner. I agree with other reviews that call for more seasonings. Not being a fan of salt it was nothing that a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper wouldn't fix. Corey liked the fact that the flavour of cauliflower was prominent. I was worried about the sauce not being thick enough so I used whole milk in the amount called for and cooked for about 5 1/2 minutes until it was as thick as I wanted it. The overall result was a creamy sauce and nicely browned topping. Personally I would add additional seasoning or another handful of cheese to the sauce and I would definitely make it again.

This could have been easier to make for a few reasons. First I would add the flour after the milk. Otherwise I ended up with a clumpy mess that I ended up tossing then starting over. Also I made a similar recipe where you add the sauce over the cooked cauliflower. That made it easier to mix the two together. Lastly I would maybe skip the margarine in the bread crumbs. This made it clumpy and more difficult to spread evenly.
I thought it was very bland. Needs some work
